alert.note: Alert for Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 7:48AM EST until February 19 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Elyria. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding along the East Branch of the Black River on Foster Road in Penfield Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM EST Saturday was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 5.3 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 04/09/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 600 PM EST.
